intro: Rhabdophyllum contractum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rock cress, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, and its seeds are enclosed in pods that split open when mature. This species is often found growing in rocky or sandy soils, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments.
